column6: >Actinic keratoses are proliferations of transformed neoplastic keratinocytes in the epidermis that are the&nbsp
column10: >result of cumulative ultraviolet (UV) radiation from sun exposure. They are commonly found on sites of&nbsp
column14: >sun-exposed skin such as the face, balding scalp, and back of the hand. Although UV exposure does exert&nbsp
column18: >certain beneficial effects on the skin, excessive exposure to UV radiation induces multiple cascades of&nbsp
column22: >molecular signaling events at the cellular level that produce inflammation, immunosuppression, failure of&nbsp
column26: >apoptosis, and aberrant differentiation. Cumulatively, these actions result in mutagenesis and, ultimately,&nbsp
column30: >carcinogenesis. This article provides a brief overview of the key mediators that are implicated in the&nbsp
column34: >pathobiology of actinic keratosis. Three evolutionary possibilities exist for these keratoses in the absence of&nbsp
column38: >treatment: (1) spontaneous remission, which can be common
column44: or (3) transformation to invasive squamous cell carcinoma, which may metastasize. Because&nbsp
column48: >the effects of UVradiation on the skin are complex, it is not yet fully clear how all of the mediators of actinic&nbsp
column52: >keratosis progression are interrelated. Nonetheless, some represent potential therapeutic targets, because it&nbsp
column56: >is clear that directing therapy to the effects of UV radiation at a number of different levels could interrupt&nbsp
column60: >and possibly reverse the mechanisms leading to malignant transformation. ( J Am Acad Dermatol&nbsp

column18: >and actinic keratosis (AK). Immunohistochemistry was performed to evaluate the expression of TIMP-3&nbsp
column22: >and MMP-9 in samples of BCC (n = 22), SCC (n = 10), and AK (n = 15). Ten fields of both tumor parenchyma&nbsp

column34: >SCC compared to BCC and AK. No significant differences in TIMP-3 expression were observed among&nbsp
column38: >the groups. Considering the well-described differences between these neoplasms, these results provide&nbsp
column42:
>additional evidence of the role of MMP-9 in tumor invasiveness of keratinocyte-derived tumors.

column6: >Cutaneous beta human papillomavirus (HPV) types appear to be involved in the development of non-melanoma skin cancer
column11: however, it is not entirely clear whether they play a direct role. We have previously shown that E6 and E7&nbsp
column15: >oncoproteins from the beta HPV type 38 display transforming activities in several experimental models. To evaluate the
column19: >possible contribution of HPV38 in a proliferative tissue compartment during carcinogenesis, we generated a new transgenic
column23: >mouse model (Tg) where HPV38 E6 and E7 are expressed in the undifferentiated basal layer of epithelia under the control of
column27: >the Keratin 14 (K14) promoter. Viral oncogene expression led to increased cellular proliferation in the epidermis of the Tg&nbsp
column31: >animals in comparison to the wild-type littermates. Although no spontaneous formation of tumours was observed during
column35: >the lifespan of the K14 HPV38 E6/E7-Tg mice, they were highly susceptible to 7,12-dimethylbenz(a)anthracene (DMBA)/12-0-
column39: >tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate (TPA) two-stage chemical carcinogenesis. In addition, when animals were exposed to
column43: >ultraviolet light (UV) irradiation, we observed that accumulation of p21WAF1 and cell-cycle arrest were significantly alleviated
column47: >in the skin of Tg mice as compared to wild-type controls. Most importantly, chronic UV irradiation of Tg mice induced the
column51: >development of actinic keratosis-like lesions, which are considered in humans as precursors of squamous cell carcinomas&nbsp
column55: >(SCC), and subsequently of SCC in a significant proportion of the animals. In contrast, wild-type animals subjected to&nbsp
column59: >identical treatments did not develop any type of skin lesions. Thus, the oncoproteins E6 and E7 from beta HPV38&nbsp
column63: >significantly contribute to SCC development in the skin rendering keratinocytes more susceptible to UV-induced&nbsp
column67:
>carcinogenesis.

column7: Actinic keratosis (AK) is a common ultraviolet lighteinduced skin lesion found on sun-exposed skin areas&nbsp
column11: >generally in older, fair-skinned people. It is part of a disease continuum observed in photodamaged skin&nbsp
column15: >that may lead to invasive squamous cell carcinoma. The presence of AK is associated with an increased risk&nbsp
column19: >of all skin cancers, as it is visible evidence of the carcinogenic effects of cumulative ultraviolet exposure.&nbsp
column23: >AKs are treated with lesion- and field-directed methods. Field-directed methods treat both the visible and&nbsp
column27: >subclinical lesions present in photodamaged skin, but treatment regimens are often lengthy and associated&nbsp
column31: >with poor tolerability because of vigorous local inflammatory reactions. Ingenol mebutate gel was recently
column35: >approved by the Food and Drug Administration for topical treatment of AK. It induces cell death&nbsp
column39: >preferentially in transformed keratinocytes and promotes an inflammatory response that kills remaining&nbsp
column43: >tumor cells. In human studies, ingenol mebutate achieved high clearance rates of AK on the trunk or&nbsp
column47: >extremities and face or scalp after once-daily application for 2 or 3 consecutive daily treatments, when&nbsp
column51: >measured by complete or partial clearance of lesions. The localized inflammatory skin responses were&nbsp
column55: >generally mild to moderate and resolved in approximately 2 weeks on the face or scalp and 4 weeks on the
column59: >trunk or extremities. ( J Am Acad Dermatol 2013

column6: Chronic, long-term sun exposure results in genetic changes in epidermal keratinocytes and the development
column10: >of various skin lesions ranging from actinic keratosis (AK) to skin cancer. AK lesions may first appear
column14: >as rough, scaly spots on sun-exposed skin, and, although most individual AK lesions do not become
column18: >invasive cancers, the majority of invasive squamous cell carcinomas originate from AK. Genetic analysis
column22: >demonstrates that ultraviolet radiationeinduced mutations and changes in gene expression are present in
column26: >squamous cell carcinoma, AK, and clinically normal-appearing perilesional sun-exposed skin, which
column30: >supports the progressive nature of keratinocyte transformation. The presence of certain clinical features,

column4: > such as large size, ulceration, or bleeding, suggests an increased risk of disease progression. The risk is also
column8: >increased by evidence of extensive solar damage, advanced age, and immunosuppression. Early diagnosis
column12: >and consideration for treatment are indicated to clear actinically damaged sites and diminish the risk of
column16: >invasive squamous cell carcinoma. ( J Am Acad Dermatol 2013

column4: >Background: The lack of well-established diagnostic criteria for pigmented solar (actinic) keratosis (PSK)

>Objective: The clinical, dermatoscopic, and histopathologic features of PSK and the cause of the
>Methods: In all, 167 histologic specimens, 22 clinical images, and 17 dermatoscopic images of PSK were
>reviewed. In 38 cases, Melan-Aestained sections were available for analysis.
>Results: The majority of the lesions were located on the head and neck (84%). A separate pigmented
column8: >lesion was adjacent to or admixed within PSK in 138 (83%) of the cases indicating that PSK represents a

column20: >suspected clinically in 17% of the cases. There were no significant differences in the quality and quantity of
column24: >the melanocytes between pigmented and nonpigmented solar keratosis.

>Conclusion: In the majority of the cases, a collision between a nonpigmented solar keratosis and a

column16: >phenomenon accounts for the spectrum of the clinical and dermatoscopic features observed in PSK and

column4: >Background: Photodynamic therapy (PDT) is a promising treatment modality for skin malignan-cies. Aminolevulinic acid (ALA)-PDT for the treatment of actinic keratosis (AK) has been wellstudied in Europe and North America. However, there have only been a few clinical studies thathave evaluated ALA-PDT for the treatment of AK in Chinese patients.

column1: Objective: The objective of our study was to determine the therapeutic response of Chinesepatients with AK lesions to photodynamic therapy (PDT), and the histologic changes associatedwith PDT.

Methods: Forty-two patients with a total of 56 AK lesions on the face were enrolled in this study.After the application of 20% ALA under occlusion for 5 h, the lesions were illuminated by diodelaser ( = 630 nm
column2: intensity 100 mW/cm2) for 30 min. All patients were reviewed at intervalsof at least 2 weeks. One month after therapy, response to PDT was evaluated and treatmentrepeated if necessary.

column1: Results: At 1 month after PDT, a complete response was achieved in 85.71% of treated lesions.The remaining lesions received one or two additional PDT treatments, and were eventuallycleared. Clinically, there was no significant scarring or pigmentary changes after therapy.

Conclusions: In this small study, PDT using topical ALA was demonstrated to be a safe andeffective therapy for AK lesions with excellent cosmetic outcome. It is a promising treatmentthat merits further study in China.©

column4: >Introduction: Spreading pigmented actinic keratosis (SPAK) is a common, but uncommonly reported or
>appreciated, variant of classic actinic keratosis (AK). It can mimic different pigmented lesions, which may
>be benign (eg, solar lentigo) or malignant (eg, lentigo maligna).
>Objective: We sought to review current data and identify areas needing further research to establish
>diagnostic guidelines for SPAK and to increase awareness of this common entity.
>Methods: A literature search was performed in both PubMed and MEDLINE databases using the search terms
>‘‘spreading pigmented actinic keratosis,’’ ‘‘pigmented solar keratosis,’’ ‘‘pigmented actinic,’’ and ‘‘pigmented
>solar.’’ Each article was retrieved, reviewed, and summarized.
>Results: SPAK is a rarely reported lesion that can be difficult to distinguish from other benign and malignant
>pigmented lesions, including seborrheic keratosis,melanoma in situ (lentigomaligna type), and lentigomaligna
>melanoma. Locatedmainly onsun-exposed areas and with a size greater than 1.5cm, the lesion typically spreads
>laterally. Pathologically, the lesion resembles classic AK with increased basal melanization. The malignancy
>potential has not yet been elucidated but destructive therapies such as cryotherapy are recommended.
>Limitations: Reports not yet published or not included in the comprehensive databases we used may exist
>Conclusions: SPAK can be associated with adjacent melanoma in situ
>increased suspicion for coexisting melanoma. ( J Am Acad Dermatol 2010

Chronic chilblains is generally considered by doctors to

column1: be a slightly inconvenient and harmless condition. We observed that a large
number of our patients showed unexpectedly severe complaints, with a distinct
impact on daily life. Adequate information about the clinical picture is
available (1_6), but we did not find any publications about how patients feel
about their symptoms, nor about the measures they take to cope with them.
Therefore, the aim of our study was to gain better insight by interviewing
patients on two issues: 1) how do patients experience chronic chilblains, and
what are their views on the condition? 2) How do patients cope with the
disease, and what are their needs?

column34: >acrokeratoelastoidosis is blurred. There is enough evidence to consider the

column7: >It is well known that physical trauma to skin caused by repetitive friction is a primary component of blister formation
column8: >. Although friction blisters in a wilderness setting particularly occur on the feet and ankles, they often form on the hands and fingers during such activities as white-water rafting, kayaking, and canoeing. These blisters are often incapacitating and can have disabling consequences. This article describes laboratory and clinical experiments testing the efficacy of a new bandage technology in reducing shear and friction forces on the skin.

column4: >Aim: To compare the magnitude of pressures generated under the foot when walking
column7: >in older people with and without plantar calluses.

column4: >Methods: Peak plantar pressure measurements were obtained from 292 participants
column7: >(99 men and 193 women) aged 62C96 years (mean ± SD 77.6 ± 6.9) recruited from
column10: >a retirement village and a university health sciences clinic. Comparisons were then
column13: >made between callused and noncallused regions of the foot.

column4: >Results: In total, 151 participants (52%) had at least one plantar callus. Those with
column7: >plantar calluses were more likely to be female, have moderate to severe hallux valgus,
column10: >and at least one lesser toe deformity. Regional peak plantar pressures were significantly
column13: >higher in people with calluses under the second metatarsophalangeal joint
column16: >(2.34 ± 0.46 vs. 2.12 ± 0.51 kg ? cm2, P ? 0.001), the third to fifth
column19: >metatarsophalangeal joints (1.71 ± 0.46 vs. 1.50 ± 0.51 kg ? cm2, P ? 0.009) and
column22: >the hallux (1.40 ± 0.34 vs. 1.23 ± 0.47 kg ? cm2, P ? 0.007) compared with people

column4: >Conclusion: Plantar pressures are significantly higher under callused regions of the
column7: >foot in older people. Raised pressure may play a role in the development of plantar
column10: >calluses by accelerating the turnover rate of keratinocytes in the epidermis. Future
column13: >studies should focus on evaluating the efficacy of pressure-relieving interventions in
column16: >the prevention and treatment of keratotic disorders in older people.

The sham procedure comprised blunt-edged scalpel paring of the callus which delivered a physical stimulus but left the hyperkeratotic tissue intact, the procedure being partially obscured from the patient. Forefoot pain was assessed using a 100 mm visual analogue scale (VAS), pressure using a high-resolution foot pressure scanner and function using the spatial-temporal gait parameters measured on an instrumented walkway. Radiographic scores of joint erosion were obtained for metatarsophalangeal (MTP) joints with and without overlying

column8: >characterized by defined self-antigens, organ specificity, autoreactive T cells
column9: >and/or autoantibodies that can transfer disease. Autoimmune blistering diseases
column10: >are organspecific autoimmune diseases associated with an immune response
column11: >directed to structural proteins mediating cellCcell and cellCmatrix adhesion in
column12: >the skin. While both autoreactive T and B cells have been detected and
column13: >characterized in patients with autoimmune blistering diseases, current evidence
column14: >generally supports a pathogenic role of autoantibodies for blister formation.
column15: >The immunopathology associated with blisters induced by autoantibodies relies
column16: >on several mechanisms of action. Autoantibodies from patients with pemphigus
column17: >diseases can exert a direct effect just by binding to their target mediated by
column18: >steric hindrance and/or by triggering the transduction of a signal to the cell.
column19: >In most subepidermal autoimmune blistering conditions, in addition to the
column20: >binding to their target antigen, autoantibodies need to interact with factors
column21: >of the innate immune system, including the complement system and inflammatory
column22: >cells, in order to induce blisters. Generally, decisive progress has been made
column23: >in the characterization of the mechanisms of blister formation in autoimmune
column24: >skin diseases. However, various aspects, including the exact contribution of
column25: >steric hindrance and signal transduction for pemphigus IgG-induced acantholysis
column26: >or the fine tuning of the inflammatory cascade triggered by autoantibodies in
column27: >some subepidermal blistering diseases, still need to be addressed.
column28: >Understanding the mechanisms by which autoantibodies induce blisters should
column29: >facilitate the development of more specific therapeutic strategies of

column17: >）。其中七项试验的数据经过荟萃分析显示对于研究者评定湿疹严重程度益生菌疗法和安慰剂疗法没有显著的差异。根据湿疹严重程度或特应性反应的存在进行亚组分析，在益生菌疗法中没有鉴定出某种特殊群体对于治疗是有效的。研究之间存在着显著的异质性，然而，使用相同的益生菌菌株进行的三组试验的研究结果是一致的。不良反应在已确认的由益生菌引起败血症和肠道缺血的病例报告中发现。

column4: >Currently, probiotics cannot be recommended for treating eczema.

column3: >目前，益生菌不能被推荐用于治疗湿疹。研究之间的异质性可能归因于益生菌菌株特异性影响，这意味着新的益生菌菌株对湿疹治疗可能还是有一定的作用。

column10: >It is a commonly expressed expert view that stress is associated with frequent recurrences of genital herpes (GH) but
column12: >the evidence for this is poor and it is often asserted that stress is the result of GH rather than any other cause. We have reviewed the
column14: >recent literature on this topic, restricting evidence to only prospective studies. We have further combined and integrated this evidence
column16: >with both human and animal work in the psychoneuroimmunological field to come up with suggestive evidence that recurrence rates
column18: >of GH are indeed associated with antecedent chronic stress/depression,
column20: >whatever might be the cause. We further discuss the
column22: >psychoneuroimmunological underpinning of the systemic features of the recurrent GH prodrome. Recommendations about holistic
column24: >management of recurrent GH that include both pharmacological and psychological therapies are given.",,"/uploadfiles/file/20131101/20131101135002_9091.pdf",,11/01/2013,11/01/2013,"medicool",37,,,0,"67",96,"Does chronic stress lead to increased rates of recurrences of genital herpes C a review of the psychoneuroimmunological evidence?","2008",

column3: >扁平苔藓样药疹（LDE）可能会出现相似或相同的特发性扁平苔藓。我们报道了一例45岁男性患者，伴有分布广泛的、紫红色、全身性丘疹性皮疹苔藓样反应的组织学特点。，后来通过停用拉贝洛尔症状消失。我们发现先前报道的29例与β-肾上腺素受体拮抗剂（β-受体阻滞剂）相关的LDE（扁平苔癣样药疹）。这是一种比较罕见的并发症，可能会出现区别于扁平苔藓的经典苔藓样丘疹，好发于四肢、胸部、背部、和口腔黏膜等处。组织学上，经常伴有嗜酸性粒细胞的青苔状浸润。LDE的出现可能是由于药物的交叉反应性的结果，或者是皮肤肾上腺素能系统被抑制的原因。案例研究中的多种潜在药物以及在横断面研究中无法区分LDE与特发性扁平苔藓之间的不同，使做出任何结论性的分析变得困难。

column7: Superficial bacterial folliculitis (SBF) is more common in the dog than other&nbsp
column11: >mammalian species. Until recently, a successful outcome in cases of canine SBF was possible&nbsp
column15: >by administering a potentiated amoxicillin, a first generation cephalosporin or a potentiated&nbsp
column19: >sulfonamide. Unfortunately, this predictable susceptibility has changed, because methicillin&nbsp
column23: >resistant Staphylococcus pseudintermedius (MRSP) and Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) are&nbsp
column27: >becoming more prevalent in canine SBF cases. The increasing frequency of multidrug&nbsp
column31: >resistance complicates the selection of antimicrobial therapy. Antimicrobial agents that were&nbsp
column35: >once rarely used in cases of canine SBF, such as amikacin, rifampicin and chloramphenicol,&nbsp
column39: >are becoming the drugs of choice, based on bacterial culture and susceptibility testing.&nbsp
column43: >Furthermore, changes in antimicrobial susceptibility have helped to re-emphasize the&nbsp
column47: >importance of a multimodal approach to treatment of the disease, including topical therapy.&nbsp
column51: >Due to the increasing frequency of identification of highly resistant Staphylococcus spp.,&nbsp
column55: >topical antimicrobial therapy, including the use of diluted sodium hypochlorite (bleach), is&nbsp
column59: >becoming necessary to successfully treat some cases of canine SBF. Other important&nbsp
column63: >antiseptics that can be used include chlorhexidine, benzoyl peroxide, ethyl lactate, triclosan&nbsp
column67: >and boric acid/acetic acid. This review discusses the diagnostic and therapeutic management&nbsp
column71: >of canine SBF, with a special emphasis on treating methicillin resistant staphylococcal&nbsp

column4: Moyamoya syndrome (MMS) is a rare, chronic progressive cerebrovascular occlusive disease that is characterized by
column5: >a stenosis or occlusion of the bilateral internal carotid arteries
column7: > We report a case of a 24-year-old woman with nephrotic syndrome whose biopsy showed membranous nephropathy. Ten months after the diagnosis she suffered sudden right hemiplegia and seizure. She was diagnosed with MMS by angiogram seven months ago and received decompressive craniotomy. The patient was admitted to our hospital and a diagnosis of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) was made. Glucocorticoids and tacrolimus were used to control the symptoms of SLE. Following one month of immunosuppressant treatment, the patient died of brain hemorrhage. This case alongside another six reviewed cases shows that an underlying cerebrovascular lesion of moyamoya in the vessels of patients with SLE is susceptible to cerebrovascular accidents.

column9: >烟雾综合征（MMS）是一种罕见的慢性渐进性脑血管闭塞性疾病，以双侧颈内动脉狭窄或闭塞为特征。我们报道了一例24岁伴有肾病综合征的女性患者，其活检显示为膜性肾病。确诊十个月后，患者突发右侧偏瘫和癫痫。七个月前，患者通过血管造影诊断出患有MMS并接受了去骨瓣减压术的治疗。患者被送到我们医院并被诊断为系统性红斑狼疮（SLE）。应用糖皮质激素和他克莫司来控制SLE的症状。免疫抑制治疗一个月后，患者死于脑出血。这则病例与其他六例回顾性病例表明， SLE患者的血管中有一种潜在的烟雾性脑血管病变，容易发生脑血管意外。

column9: >Oral lichen planus (OLP) is a chronic inflammatory disease for which the pathogenesis is not fully&nbsp
column13: >understood. OLP has autoimmune features and auto immunity has been suggested as a potential cause, whereas&nbsp
column17: >WHO has classified OLP as a premalignant condition. Association between chronic inflammation and cancer is&nbsp
column21: >known and chronic inflammation is one of the characteristics of OLP. A protein connected to inflammation and&nbsp
column25: >suggested to be involved in cancer development is cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) which can be inhibited by microRNA-

column9: >The aim was to map levels of COX-2 and miR-26b in OLP lesions to see if there was any correlation&nbsp
column13: >between expression of COX-2 and its regulator miR-26b in OLP.
>In biopsies from 20 OLP patients and 20 age and gender-matched controls laser- micro dissection of&nbsp
column17: >epithelium was performed. Quantitative RT-PCR, immunohistochemistry and Western blot were used in the analysis.

column9: >Levels of COX-2 mRNA were significantly higher while levels of miR-26b were significantly lower in OLP&nbsp
column13: >lesions compared to controls. Using immunohistochemistry normal oral mucosa samples did not show any&nbsp
column17: >expression of COX-2 while OLP samples expressed the protein. No COX-2 protein was detectable with Western&nbsp

column9: >Increased expression of COX-2 and decreased expression of miR-26b in OLP suggests both to play a&nbsp
column13: >role in OLP. COX-2 has been connected to both malignant development and autoimmunity but as malignant&nbsp
column17: >development of OLP is quite rare we suggest that the increased levels of COX-2 seen here support an autoimmune&nbsp
column21:
>cause of the disease.

column6: >We present a case series of 25
column7: >paediatric patients with refractory discoid eczema treated with methotrexate.
column8: >Patients were commenced on either 5 mg or 10 mg of methotrexate per week.
column9: >Sixteen patients (64%) completely cleared their eczema after an average of 10.5
column10: >months of methotrexate therapy. A further three patients (12%) have responded
column11: >well and are almost clear at the time of writing. Methotrexate was well
column12: >tolerated by the majority of patients and no serious adverse events were
column13: >observed. Methotrexate should be considered in moderate to severe paediatric
column14: >discoid eczema that has failed to respond to conventional therapies.

column11: Disseminatedcases of histoplasmosis inacquired immunedeficiency syndrome (AIDS)are rarelyreported from IndiaMost of these casesreport isolation ofthis fungus fromthe bone marrow,lymphnode aspirate,spleenicaspirate, and biopsies.Wereport isolation ofHistoplasmacapsulatumfromthe blood of an AIDS patient.A 30-year-old malefrom Utter Pradesh was admitted with fever, loss of appetite, and nausea sincetwo months.Few intracellular andextracellular budding cells were observed on bone marrow examination on the fifthday of admission.Diagnosis was confirmed by blood cultures takenon the 11th day of admission.Amphotericin B wasstarted, but the patient’s condition deteriorated and he died.

column10: 播散性组织胞浆菌病在获得性免疫缺乏综合症（艾滋病）患者中的病例在印度很少被报道。大部分病例报道的是从骨髓、淋巴结穿刺、脾穿刺和活检中分离的这种真菌。我们报告了从艾滋病患者血液中分离出的荚膜组织胞浆菌。一名来自北方邦的30岁男性承认两个月以来有发热、食欲不振、恶心的症状。入院第五天时，骨髓检查发现几乎没有胞内和胞外出芽的细胞。入院第11天时取血通过血液培养确诊。两性霉素B开始起作用，但病人病情恶化并死亡。

Kaposi’s sarcoma (KS) is one of the most common diseases seen in patients
in Japan. We herein report a case of AIDS- associated KS of the tongue, which
was initially misdiagnosed as recurrent hemangioma according to the initial
histopathological diagnosis. The patient is a 42-year-old male who had been
suffering from a painful vascular neoplasm-like mass on the dorsum of the
tongue. The patient did not complain of any other distinct symptoms and a
debulking operation was planned based on the clinical diagnosis of hemangioma.
However, preoperative blood tests revealed the presence of syphilis and the
human immunode?ciency virus and the patient was therefore diagnosed to have
full-blown AIDS. Therefore, the patient’s oral lesion was then instead suspected
to be oral KS (OKS). A histopathological examination of the tongue biopsy
specimen showed the typical ?ndings of KS. Combination active antiretroviral
therapy (cART) combined with liposomal doxorubicin was administered and the
patient achieved a complete remission (CR). In conclusion, clinicians including oral surgeons, should take OKS into account in the diagnosis of vascular
neoplasm-like masses of the tongue in adults since this complication may occur
|Combination  active  antiretroviral  therapy(cART)",0,"85",19,"A case of AIDS-associated oral Kaposi’s sarcoma of the tongue","2012",

column9: >Oral Lichen Planus (OLP), is a chronic, inflammatory disease of immunological disorder. The most &nbsp
column13: >important complication of OLP is the development of oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC). Survivin is an &nbsp
column17: >inhibitor of apoptosis gene and encourages the continued proliferation and survival of tumors. The aim of this study &nbsp
column21: >was to detect the level of Survivin as a molecular indicator of malignancy in control, reticulo-papular and&nbsp
column25: >bollous-erosive OLP patients using immunohistochemistry. Materials and Methods: 25 subjects participated in this&nbsp
column29: >study,10 reticulo-papular, 5 bollousCerosive OLP patients and 10 healthy controls. All subjects were non-smokers&nbsp
column33: >and systemically free to standardize their medical condition. All patients and controls were subjected to biopsy&nbsp
column37: >procedures from the buccal mucosa for histopathological examination &nbsp
column38: and immunostained with Survivin using the&nbsp
column42: >Ultra Vision System. Results: This study showed a highly significant difference (P&lt
column47: >density between the control group and OLP groups. The highest values were observed in the bullous-erosive group.&nbsp
column51: >Mean Survivin area % was nearly 30 % in the reticulo-papular group, 90% in the bollous-erosive group, but only&nbsp
column55: >around 10% in the control group. Conclusion: Survivin levels are higher in OLP than in healthy tissue and highest in&nbsp
column59: >bullous-erosive forms of OLP compared to the reticulo-papular form. Bullous-erosive forms of OLP are hence more&nbsp
column63: >liable to turn malignant than reticulo-papular forms. Diagnosis of OLP patients histopathologically together with&nbsp
column67: >molecular profiling and localization of their Survivin levels, can be therefore used as an early biomarker for&nbsp
column71: >malignant transformation, before the appearance of tissue abnormalities.&nbsp

column6: Keratin 16 (KRT16 in human, Krt16 in mouse), a type I intermediate filament protein, is constitutively expressed&nbsp
column10: >in epithelial appendages and is induced in the epidermis upon wounding and other stressors. Mutations&nbsp
column14: >altering the coding sequence of KRT16 cause pachyonychia congenita (PC), a rare autosomal dominant disorder&nbsp
column18: >characterized by hypertrophic nail dystrophy, oral leukokeratosis, and palmoplantar keratoderma (PPK). PPK&nbsp
column22: >associated with PC is extremely painful and compromises patient mobility, making it the most debilitating PC&nbsp
column26: >symptom. In this study, we show that, although inherited in a recessive manner, the inactivation of Krt16 in mice&nbsp
column30: >consistently causes oral lesions as well as PPK-like hyperkeratotic calluses on Krt16/ front and hind paws,&nbsp
column34: >which severely compromise the animals’ ability to walk. Our findings call into question the view that PC-related&nbsp
column38: >PPK arises exclusively as a gain-of-function on account of dominantly acting mutated keratins, and highlight the&nbsp
column42: >key role of modifiers in the clinical heterogeneity of PC symptoms.

column2: >Background. Mycosis fungoides (MF) and the Se?zary syndrome (SS) are non-Hodgkin’s

column2: >Methods. We conducted a retrospective review of 1562 prospectively collected patients at
column4: >the MD Anderson Cancer Center Cutaneous Lymphoma Clinic over sixteen years. All&nbsp
column6: >patients’ palms and soles were evaluated for clinical evidence of keratoderma (hyperkeratosis)&nbsp

column10: >potassium hydroxide by light microscopy for hyphae.

column2: >Results. Of 138 Se?zary syndrome patients (88 men, 50 women, median age at diagnosis
column7: >patients (52.9%) also had coexisting tinea pedis. Only 14 (10.1%) had tinea pedis without&nbsp
column9: >keratoderma. Treatment for tinea pedis resulted in microscopy cure of keratoderma in 12&nbsp

column2: >Conclusions. The prevalence of palmoplantar keratoderma in Se?zary syndrome is 61.6%,

column8: >to the pathogenesis and severity of Se?zary syndrome-related keratoderma.

column3: In autosomal dominant skin disorders, a pronounced mosaic involvement may sometimes be found to be&nbsp
column7: >superimposed on the ordinary nonsegmental lesions. Such ‘‘type 2 segmental manifestation’’ reflects loss of&nbsp
column11: >heterozygosity occurring at an early developmental stage, giving rise to a cell clone that lacks the&nbsp
column15: >corresponding wild-type allele. Here, this genetic concept is applied to an unusual case of plaque-type&nbsp
column19: >porokeratosis of Mibelli (PM) as published in 1893 by Vittorio Mibelli in the International Atlas of Rare Skin&nbsp
column23: >Diseases. The right forearm and hand of the 21-year-old patient showed a pronounced linear porokeratosis&nbsp
column27: >that had developed since the age of 2 years. Moreover, nonsegmental lesions of PM involved both hands&nbsp
column31: >and forearms as well as the face and the neck, having first been noticed at the age of 7 years. Two siblings&nbsp
column35: >and the father were likewise affected with PM. Hence, Mibelli’s case from 1893 meets all of the criteria of a&nbsp
column39: >type 2 segmental manifestation of an autosomal dominant skin disorder. Recognizing such cases of&nbsp
column43: >superimposed segmental involvement may help elucidate the molecular basis of PM.

column2: >毛囊角化病（DD）是一种常染色体显性遗传性皮肤病。因为该疾病是一种慢性病症以及各种药物潜在刺激,因此治疗常常是困难的并且疗效难以令人满意。系统性维生素A衍生物如维生素A酸和异维A酸是首选的治疗药物，但它们的使用往往受到特定类的副作用限制。阿利维A酸（9 - 顺式 - 视黄酸），具有抗增殖和抗炎的作用，并且在许多国家中，被许可用于慢性手部湿疹的系统治疗。与维生素Ａ酸不同的是，阿利维A酸要求避孕的育龄妇女在治疗结束后，再延长1个月的治疗。有证据表明，阿利维A酸可能是系统治疗各种维生素A酸反应性皮肤疾病的耐受性良好的替代药物。我们报道了两例应用阿利维A酸成功治愈的难治性DD患者，并且没有出现明显副作用，患者皮损处几乎完全缓解。

column3: >Background ATP2A2 encoding the sarcoplasmic ?endoplasmic reticulum Ca2+-&nbsp
column4: ATPase2 (SERCA2) is a Darier disease (DD)-related gene. Ultraviolet (UV) B&nbsp
column5: irradiation downregulates ATP2A2 ?SERCA2 expression in keratinocytes, whereas&nbsp
column6: cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) expression is dramatically upregulated by UVB.

column3: >Objectives To analyse the involvement of COX-2 in ATP2A2 ?SERCA2 expression.
>Methods Keratinocytes were transfected with COX-2 siRNA or treated with COX-2&nbsp
column4: inhibitor, celecoxib, to evaluate the effect of COX-2 on ATP2A2 ?SERCA2 expression.
column6: >Quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction, Western blotting analysis&nbsp
column7: and reporter assay were used to determine the amount of mRNA, protein level&nbsp

column3: >Results COX-2 knockdown by siRNA resulted in upregulation of ATP2A2 transcription.&nbsp
column4: Treatment by celecoxib rescued UVB-mediated suppression of the ATP2A2&nbsp
column5: transcription and SERCA2 protein expression. Simple addition of prostaglandin&nbsp
column6: (PG) E2, which is a product of COX-2 enzyme, reduced the amounts of ATP2A2&nbsp
column7: mRNA and SERCA2 protein in keratinocytes.

column3: >Conclusions UVB downregulates ATP2A2 ?SERCA2 expression via induction of COX-2&nbsp
column4: expression and subsequent increase of PGE2 production in keratinocytes. Considering&nbsp
column5: that DD is caused by the decreased function of SERCA2 due to the reduced&nbsp
column6: expression of the ATP2A2 gene, this finding shows the possibility that COX-2&nbsp
column7: inhibition may be useful to prevent and ?or treat DD.

column3: >BACKGROUND Wide-excision surgery is required in Darier-Ferrand dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans, but&nbsp

column3: > MATERIALS AND METHODS We performed a systematic review based on a MEDLINE search of articles,&nbsp
column6: >published from 1994 to 2009 to determine the optimal procedure to avoid recurrences and treatment&nbsp

column3: > RESULTS The analyzed articles included five meta-analyses of retrospective studies
> DISCUSSION Positive deep margins may lead to a recurrence independent of lateral margin status. Despite&nbsp
column6: >an absence of formal evidence, wide excision with 3-cm margins appears to result in significantly less risk of a&nbsp
column10: 3-cm margins. Negative histologic margins appear to be the best criterion to&nbsp
column13: >decrease recurrence. Despite a lack of strong data, there was a marked tendency of Mohs micrographic&nbsp
column16: >surgery (MMS) to produce better results than conventional surgery. If MMS is unavailable, surgery using 3-cm&nbsp
column19: >lateral margins and a disease-free anatomic zone deep into the lesion is proposed. Slow Mohs could be a safe&nbsp
column22: >alternative to MMS when the latter technique is not available. Patients should be followed for a minimum of&nbsp
column25:
>10 years and preferably indefinitely.

column3: >Background: Keratosis pilaris (KP) is a very common disorder
column4: yet, very few treatment options are available. Objectives: To&nbsp
column7: >evaluate the efficacy of long-pulsed 1064-nm Nd:YAG laser for the treatment of KP. Materials and methods: Eighteen patients&nbsp
column10: >with untreated KP on the upper outer arms were enrolled in a randomized clinical trial. One arm was treated with longpulsed&nbsp
column13: >1064-nm Nd:YAG laser at 30 msec pulse width and fluence of 34 J/cm2, while the contralateral arm served as control.
column15: >Patients received three consecutive treatments at 4-week intervals. Three blinded dermatologists assessed digital photographs&nbsp
column18: >using a quartile grading system to separately rate global improvement, erythema and the number of keratotic papules.

column4: >Seventeen patients completed the study. There were statistically significant improvements in global assessment, erythema and&nbsp
column5: the number of keratotic papules at 4 weeks after the last treatment (p &lt
column6: 0.05). All patients also stated that their lesions improved&nbsp
column7: and were satisfied with the laser treatment.

column1: Conclusion: Long-pulsed 1064-nm Nd:YAG laser has been shown to improve KP&nbsp
column2: in Thai patients compared with control after three treatment sessions.

column33: >region, but no causative mutation was found. This study provides a map location for&nbsp

column1: and Methods: The study included all the adult patients with definite diagnosis

remission in less than one year and the mean time elapsed for reaching the
remission were assessed and compared between the two groups. Chi-square test, Fisher’s
exact test, t-test and Pearson correlation test were used for data analysis.

column3: >Background: HPV is related to a number of cancer types, causing a considerable burden in both genders in
column5: >Europe. Female vaccination programs can substantially reduce the incidence of HPV-related diseases in women
column7: >and, to some extent, men through herd immunity. The objective was to estimate the incremental benefit of
column9: >vaccinating boys and girls using the quadrivalent HPV vaccine in Europe versus girls-only vaccination. Incremental
column11: >benefits in terms of reduction in the incidence of HPV 6, 11, 16 and 18-related diseases (including cervical, vaginal,
column13: >vulvar, anal, penile, and head and neck carcinomas and genital warts) were assessed.

column3: > Methods: The analysis was performed using a model constructed in MicrosoftWExcel, based on a
column5: >previously-published dynamic transmission model of HPV vaccination and published European epidemiological data
column7: >on incidence of HPV-related diseases. The incremental benefits of vaccinating 12-year old girls and boys versus
column9: >girls-only vaccination was assessed (70% vaccine coverage were assumed for both). Sensitivity analyses around
column11: >vaccine coverage and duration of protection were performed.

column3: > Results: Compared with screening alone, girls-only vaccination led to 84% reduction in HPV 16/18-related
column5: >carcinomas in females and a 61% reduction in males. Vaccination of girls and boys led to a 90% reduction in HPV
column7: >16/18-related carcinomas in females and 86% reduction in males versus screening alone. Relative to a girls-only
column9: >program, vaccination of girls and boys led to a reduction in female and male HPV-related carcinomas of 40% and
column11: >65%, respectively and a reduction in the incidence of HPV 6/11-related genital warts of 58% for females and 71%

column3: > Conclusions: In Europe, the vaccination of 12-year old boys and girls against HPV 6, 11, 16 and 18 would be
column5: >associated with substantial additional clinical benefits in terms of reduced incidence of HPV-related genital warts
column7: >and carcinomas versus girls-only vaccination. The incremental benefits of adding boys vaccination are highly
column9: >dependent on coverage in girls. Therefore, further analyses should be performed taking into account the
column11: >country-specific situation. In addition to clinical benefits, substantial economic benefits are also anticipated and
column13: >warrant further investigation as do the social and ethical implications of including boys in vaccination programs

column6: >目的 探讨神经性皮炎的中西医治疗疗效.方法 随机将齐齐哈尔市碾子山区疾病预防控制中心门诊2008年1月至2009年11月收治的135例神经性皮炎患者分为观察组69例、对照组66例,对照组进行西医对症治疗,观察组进行中西医结合治疗,对两组临床疗效进行分析比较.结果 观察组临床治愈率为75.36%,治疗总有效率为91.30%
column7: 对照组临床治愈率为59.09%,治疗总有效率为77.27%.观察组临床治愈率、总有效率与对照组相比有显著性差异(χ2=4.07,P&lt
column10: 0.05).治疗前后监测两组血常规、肝肾功未见明显异常.所有患者均随访8～12个月,两组复发率比较有显著性差异(χ2=4.53,P&lt
column11: 0.05).结论 中西医结合治疗神经性皮炎临床疗效显著,远期复发率低,值得临床进一步应用.

column7: Lichen simplex chronicus (LSC) of the anogenital area is an eczematous disease characterized
column8: >by unremitting itching and scratching. In most instances, it arises in individuals who are
column9: >genetically atopic, and as such, LSC can be viewed as a localized variant of atopic/neurodermatitis.
column10: >Common triggers for the development of the disease include psychological distress, and local environmental
column11: >problems such as heat, sweating, and excess dryness. Lichen simplex chronicus may also
column12: >develop as a superimposed condition in the presence of other anogenital diseases such as candidiasis,
column13: >psoriasis, lichen sclerosus, tinea cruris, and neoplasia. Lichen simplex chronicus frequently persists
column14: >as an itch-scratch cycle, even when environmental triggers are removed and the underlying disease is
column15: >treated. For this reason, successful therapy requires attention not only to trigger factors, but also to
column16: >repair of the damaged barrier layer, reduction in inflammation, and breakup of the itch-scratch cycle.

column3: >An increasing body of evidence, including epidemiological data, clinical and histopathologic observations, and molecular biological

column13: >c evidence accumulated over the past decade supports the concept that AK should no longer be considered premalignant but instead is now thought to be the earliest stage of a biologic continuum ending in squamous cell carcinoma.
column15: >This paradigm shift, coupled with a worldwide increase in the incidence of AK, has changed how dermatologists treat AK.

column30: >cacy data for emerging interval and combination therapies used to treat AK.

column1: To evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a disk microneedle therapy system (DTS) in the

Sixteen Korean volunteers with striae distensae alba or rubra were enrolled. Patients received three treatments using a DTS at 4-week intervals. Clinical response to treatment was assessed by comparing pre- and post-treatment clinical photographs, skin biopsies, and patient satisfaction scores. Clinical improvement was assessed using the quartile grading scale.

>根据症状持续的时间和是否存在诱导刺激，通常将荨麻疹分为急性荨麻疹、慢性荨麻疹或物理性荨麻疹。在荨麻疹这个大类下还包含荨麻疹性血管炎、接触性荨麻疹和特殊综合征。在我们了解的关于慢性荨麻疹的发病机制的最新进展中发现近一半慢性特发性荨麻疹患者体内有肥
column5: >大细胞自身抗体的受体。
column7: >这些患者可能患有更严重的疾病并且需要更有效的治疗。对慢性荨麻疹患者进行广泛的实验室评估，通常未见异常，并没有可信的数据证明荨麻疹与慢性传染病或恶性肿瘤之间有关联。药物治疗主要包括恰当使用第一代和第二代组胺H1受体抗组胺药。对于严重性，反复发作的疾病，其他的疗法可能包括应用白三烯受体抗结剂、糖皮质激素和免疫调剂剂。尽管我们对荨麻疹的发病机制有了更深入
